content: Yes, it is possible that monasticism can be beneficial for people who are not necessarily religious but seek a more intentional and focused life. The principles of monasticism, such as mindfulness, simplicity, and service, can be practiced by anyone seeking a greater sense of purpose and connection. By living a simple and disciplined lifestyle, one can cultivate a greater sense of inner peace and clarity. In addition, monasticism emphasizes community and service to others, which can be a source of joy and fulfillment for those seeking to make a positive impact on the world. Ultimately, the benefits of monasticism depend on personal perspective, goals, and values.
